queries.query_text: What is the rule about CHAPTER 2: ANCESTRIES &  BACKGROUNDS?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about CHAPTER 2: ANCESTRIES &  BACKGROUNDS?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about Starfinder contains as many species as there are stars in the sky. This section details a wide variety of  new and updated ancestries that are prevalent in the Starfinder setting. It also provides details on the  use of languages in Starfinder, from within the core of the Pact Worlds to countless planets beyond!?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about Starfinder contains as many species as there are stars in the sky. This section ?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about A character has one ancestry and one background, both of  which you select during character creation. You'll also select  a number of languages for your character. Once chosen, your  ancestry and background can't be changed.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about A character has one ancestry and one background, both of  which you select durin?

queries.query_text: Summarize This chapter is divided into four parts.
queries.query_text_short: Summarize This chapter is divided into four parts.

queries.query_text: What is the rule about **Ancestries** express the lineage your character hails from.  Within ancestries are heritages—subgroups that have  unique characteristics. An ancestry provides attribute  boosts (and perhaps attribute flaws), Hit Points, ancestry  feats, and sometimes additional abilities.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about **Ancestries** express the lineage your character hails from.  Within ancestries?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about **Versatile** **heritages**, starting on page 82, are heritage  options available to all ancestries for extra customization,  such as characters with more unique or unusual origins.  These are selected instead of a standard heritage.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about **Versatile** **heritages**, starting on page 82, are heritage  options availabl?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about **Backgrounds**, starting on page 92, describe training  or environments your character experienced before  becoming an adventurer. Your character's background  provides attribute boosts, skill training, and a skill feat.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about **Backgrounds**, starting on page 92, describe training  or environments your ch?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about **Languages**, starting on page 97, let your character  communicate with people and creatures of the galaxy.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about **Languages**, starting on page 97, let your character  communicate with people ?

queries.query_text: Summarize ANCESTRY ENTRIES
queries.query_text_short: Summarize ANCESTRY ENTRIES

queries.query_text: What is the rule about Each entry includes details about the ancestry and presents  the rules elements described below.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about Each entry includes details about the ancestry and presents  the rules elements ?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about HIT POINTS?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about HIT POINTS?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about This tells you how many HP your PC gains from their ancestry  at 1st level. You'll add the HP from your character's class  (including their Constitution modifier) to this number. For more  on calculating HP, see Step 7: Record Class Details (page 21).?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about This tells you how many HP your PC gains from their ancestry  at 1st level. You'?

queries.query_text_short: Summarize SIZE

queries.query_text: Summarize This tells you the physical size of members of the ancestry.  Medium corresponds roughly to the height and weight range  of a human adult, and Small is roughly half that.
queries.query_text_short: Summarize This tells you the physical size of members of the ancestry.  Medium corresponds

queries.query_text_short: Summarize SPEED

queries.query_text: Summarize ATTRIBUTE BOOSTS & FLAWS
queries.query_text_short: Summarize ATTRIBUTE BOOSTS & FLAWS

queries.query_text: What is the rule about When creating a character of this ancestry, you apply attribute?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about When creating a character of this ancestry, you apply attribute?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about boosts to increase some attribute modifiers, and possibly  attribute flaws to decrease others (depending on the ancestry).  For more about attribute boosts and flaws, see page 23.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about boosts to increase some attribute modifiers, and possibly  attribute flaws to de?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about **Alternate** **Ancestry** **Boosts:** Because of the wide variety of  people within any ancestry, you can *always* choose to take two  free boosts to represent your character, even if the ancestry  normally has three boosts and a flaw.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about **Alternate** **Ancestry** **Boosts:** Because of the wide variety of  people wi?

queries.query_text_short: Summarize LANGUAGES

queries.query_text: What is the rule about This tells you the languages that members of the ancestry  speak at 1st level. If your Intelligence modifier is +1 or higher,  you can select more languages from a list given here. More  about languages can be found on page 97.?

queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about These descriptors have no mechanical benefit, but they're  important for determi?

queries.query_text: Summarize SPECIAL ABILITIES
queries.query_text_short: Summarize SPECIAL ABILITIES

queries.query_text: Summarize Any other entries in the sidebar represent abilities, senses,  and other qualities all members of the ancestry manifest.  These are omitted for ancestries with no special rules.
queries.query_text_short: Summarize Any other entries in the sidebar represent abilities, senses,  and other qualiti

queries.query_text: Summarize HERITAGES
queries.query_text_short: Summarize HERITAGES

queries.query_text: Summarize You select a heritage at 1st level to reflect abilities common  among those of your ancestry in the environment where  you were born or grew up. You have only one heritage and  can't change it later. A heritage isn't the same as a culture  or ethnicity, though some cultures or ethnicities might have  more or fewer members from a particular heritage.
queries.query_text_short: Summarize You select a heritage at 1st level to reflect abilities common  among those of y

queries.query_text: What is the rule about ANCESTRY FEATS?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about ANCESTRY FEATS?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about This section presents ancestry feats, which allow you to  customize your character. You gain your first ancestry feat  at 1st level, and you gain another at 5th level, 9th level, 13th  level, and 17th level, as indicated in the class advancement  table in the descriptions of each class.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about This section presents ancestry feats, which allow you to  customize your charact?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about As a starting character, you can choose from only 1stlevel ancestry feats, but later choices can be made from any  feat of your level or lower. These feats also sometimes list  prerequisites, which are conditions that your character must  fulfill to select that feat.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about As a starting character, you can choose from only 1stlevel ancestry feats, but l?

queries.query_text: Summarize ANDROID
queries.query_text_short: Summarize ANDROID

queries.query_text: What is the rule about Androids first emerged as synthetic beings crafted by many technologically advanced civilizations throughout the galaxy. The first androids were created by humanoid peoples in their own images, but after the technology that animated the living constructs spread, androids began displaying a fantastic diversity of forms. Androids in the Pact Worlds were originally designed as servants, but today androids and other robotic beings stand as equals to organic ancestries under the Pact. Some androids have formed their own independent communities, while most integrate seamlessly into Pact Worlds societies. Unlike many other technological constructs, androids are more than intricate synthetic organs and complex programming, and each possesses their own soul.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about Androids first emerged as synthetic beings crafted by many technologically advan?

queries.query_text_short: Summarize CONSTRUCTED

queries.query_text: What is the rule about Your synthetic body resists ailments better than that of a purely biological organism. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against diseases, poisons, and radiation. You always have basic environmental protections (page 268).?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about Your synthetic body resists ailments better than that of a purely biological org?

queries.query_text: Summarize Try to avoid others taking advantage of you.

queries.query_text: Summarize Seek to understand your purpose in the wider galaxy.
queries.query_text_short: Summarize Seek to understand your purpose in the wider galaxy.

queries.query_text: Summarize Judge others based on how they treat service workers,  blue-collar laborers, fans, or pets.

queries.query_text: Summarize Have some level of guilt for their ancestors' use of  your species as laborers.
queries.query_text_short: Summarize Have some level of guilt for their ancestors' use of  your species as laborers.

queries.query_text: What is the rule about Androids thrive in nearly any environment and exist as part  of countless cultures, meaning they can be found almost  anywhere in the galaxy. Many androids are curious about their  origins, traveling alone or with others in search of answers to  a variety of metaphysical and material questions about their  identities and the greater cosmos. Androids are diverse, with  few individuals sharing the exact same appearance, despite  their manufactured state.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about Androids thrive in nearly any environment and exist as part  of countless cultur?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about If you want to roleplay a synthetic character on a journey  of self-discovery, you should play an android.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about If you want to roleplay a synthetic character on a journey  of self-discovery, y?

queries.query_text: Summarize PHYSICAL DESCRIPTION
queries.query_text_short: Summarize PHYSICAL DESCRIPTION

queries.query_text: Summarize Androids are biomechanical constructs who typically  resemble humanoids with glowing circuitry. Most were  created in specialized birthing sites called foundries.  Older variants of androids, such as androids on Golarion,  were primarily biological, but androids in the modern era  usually incorporate more technological components and  synthetic elements into their bodies. Androids need to eat  and sleep, but they don't reproduce, don't age, and have no  innate concept of gender—though many express humanoid  gender identities or shift fluidly between them. Most  androids voluntarily release their bodies after a century or  so, allowing new souls to inhabit them in a process called  renewal.
queries.query_text_short: Summarize Androids are biomechanical constructs who typically  resemble humanoids with glo

queries.query_text: Summarize SOCIETY
queries.query_text_short: Summarize SOCIETY

queries.query_text: What is the rule about Androids tend to be cautious when visiting new places and  meeting new people. Once comfortable, androids can form  tight bonds of friendship and kinship, adopting found families,  and choosing entire neighborhoods and communities as their  home, rather than remaining confined by the boundaries  formed by walls. Androids often go out of their way to help  one another and their chosen families and communities,  and most hesitate to destroy the body of another android,  knowing that to do so ends not only one life, but erases the  countless other souls who could one day inhabit that body.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about Androids tend to be cautious when visiting new places and  meeting new people. O?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about Androids hold a variety of religious and philosophical  views, with individuals sometimes collecting beliefs and  practices through decades of lived experiences. With a  similar perspective to elves and other long-lived species,  androids tend to view reality differently than beings with?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about Androids hold a variety of religious and philosophical  views, with individuals ?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about shorter lifespans. Many androids are patient in achieving  their goals and might create plans that span decades or  centuries, hoping they will be alive to experience the results.  Elder androids who voluntarily pass on to the next part of  their cycle sometimes bequeath their goals to the next soul  to inhabit their body.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about shorter lifespans. Many androids are patient in achieving  their goals and might?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about **Popular Edicts** discover your origins, help others achieve  long-term goals, plan for the future?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about **Popular Edicts** discover your origins, help others achieve  long-term goals, ?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about Your body wasn't created in the image of a biological creature;  a powerful artificial intelligence created you to interface with  other machines. Your physiology is nearly identical to other  androids, but uncanny details give away your non-standard  origins (for example, you might have impossibly symmetrical  features, extra fingers, or double pupils). You become trained  in Computers, and you gain the Phreaker skill feat.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about Your body wasn't created in the image of a biological creature;  a powerful arti?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about You or your previous iterations have modified your body to be  compatible with armor upgrades, enabling you to personally  customize your body and its capabilities. Your body has one  armor upgrade slot that you can use to install armor upgrades  and that doesn't count toward your armor's total number of  upgrades. You can install and uninstall armor upgrades into  your personal upgrade slot using the Install Upgrade activity.  Choose one common armor upgrade with an item level of 1  or less. You begin with this armor upgrade already installed  in your upgrade slot (you don't need to pay the credits to  purchase this starting upgrade).?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about You or your previous iterations have modified your body to be  compatible with a?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about Your body was modified to network seamlessly with other tech  creatures. You gain shortwave, allowing you to communicate  wirelessly with any creatures within 30 feet, as long as  they have shortwave or are a construct with the tech trait.  This doesn't give any special access to their thoughts or  programming and communicates no more information than  normal speech would. You can attempt Computers checks?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about Your body was modified to network seamlessly with other tech  creatures. You gai?

queries.query_text: What is the rule about Many souls have inhabited your synthetic body before you,  and you might incorporate a number into your name to honor  them. You might know your body's history and work toward a  goal bequeathed to you by a departed soul, or you might seek  to learn the mystery of a forgotten legacy. Muscle memory  hints at your body's past, and people you've never met  sometimes recognize your face. The first time in a day that  you lose the dying condition, you don't gain the wounded  condition. You become trained in a skill of your choice that  has the Recall Knowledge action, and you gain the Dubious  Knowledge skill feat.?
queries.query_text_short: What is the rule about Many souls have inhabited your synthetic body before you,  and you might incorpo?
